Job Description:
A Career at Rheem: Where Comfort Is Your Calling

At Rheem, we are dedicated to bringing comfort to people’s lives. As a leading global manufacturer of heating, cooling and water heating equipment, we are innovating all-new ways to deliver just the right temperature while saving energy, water and supporting a more sustainable future. It is an exciting challenge that requires a team of talented, passionate people with a diverse set of skills. From engineers to accountants, sales professionals to support experts, Rheem depends on people to power our innovations. Join Rheem, and help shape the future of products that impact lives—every day.

The Principle Engineer is responsible for leading project and program development in the realization of general business product design objectives. Makes decisions and recommendations recognized as authoritative and has an important impact on extensive engineering activities. Applies judgment, in assistance to the manager, in determining program technical objectives and requirements, organizing programs and projects, and developing standards and guides for diverse engineering activities.

Responsibilities:

· Recognized leader and authority in their organization in a broad area of specialization or a narrow but intensely specialized field.

· Selects research problems to further the organization’s objectives and conceives and plans investigations or broad areas of considerable novelty and importance where engineering precedents are lacking in areas critical to the overall engineering program.

· Consulted extensively by associates and others with a high degree of reliance placed on their scientific interpretations and advice.

· Contributes inventions, new designs, or techniques that are regarded as major advances in their field.

· Participate in planning objectives and furthering business opportunities for the company derived from broad general objectives and limits.

· Support departmental priorities for all water heating development projects: Safety, Quality, Cost reduction, New product development

· Plan short-range and long-range water heating product development programs to achieve and fulfill: Market requirements, Good manufacturing practices, Product cost requirements, the Best balance of manpower, expense and desired program completion dates, Regulatory requirements

· Serve as a consultant in the process of solving field and production support that require design changes, component or material substitutions, etc.

· Provide sound estimates of time and expense required for engineering projects, Good communication channels for program progress up and down within the Division organization, Recommendations of personnel and facilities needed to accomplish engineering goals.

· Initiates and maintains extensive contacts with key engineers and associates of other organizations, regulatory agencies, and suppliers, requiring skill in persuasion and negotiation of critical issues.

· Assist the Manager in providing coaching, motivational and professional development advice to other members of the department.

· Participate in industry standards development activities when needed.

· Supervise employees assigned to the project group and be responsible for contractual fulfillment of the assigned projects. Define objectives, prepare specifications, plans and schedules and assign. responsibilities to subordinates. Coordinate the design, development, manufacture, test, and delivery of projects.

· Analyze and or perform research and testing on potential designs as they relate to numerous requirements including agency, shop, fit, cost, strength, and schedule.

· Prepare progress reports to management covering all phases of the project.

· Apply physical, electrical, and mathematical concepts to solve design problems, and the creation of new designs.

· Manage projects of large and small scale, to ensure the project is executed within time, cost, and budget constraints.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES: Yes.

Qualifications:

· Bachelor’s OR Master’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering.

· 5-8 years of related experience in project management within a product development environment, or a graduate degree with 5- 8 years of related experience in project management in a product development environment.

· 5+ years Providing work direction.

· Excellent communication skills, written and verbal, with attention to detail and accuracy.

· Proficient computer skills and in-depth knowledge of relevant software such as MS Office Suite and MS Project.

· Working knowledge of SolidWorks or equivalent design software.

· Demonstrated ability to work well with others in a matrix team environment.

· Strong analytical, problem-solving, communication, and leadership skills required.

· Management of large and complex projects from inception to completion.

· Knowledge of engineering release processes, lean manufacturing principles, six sigma, Design for Manufacturability and Assembly (DFMA), PCB Design software, Product life cycle, and controls.

· Comprehension of cost and financial accounting principles, vendor identification and development, capacity and methods analysis, and tooling and metal fabrication processes.

· Minimum 10 years experience in product design and development engineering.

· Ability to apply broad engineering principles related to mechanical, structural, electrical, and materials to the design of water heating products.

· Strong project management, analytical and financial skills.

· Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

· Business analysis and decision-making skills.

· Familiar with the capabilities of typical design software utilized for CAD, FEA, CFD, etc.

· Experience with agency approval requirements and familiarity with appliance standards development

· Ability to write effective reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals.

· Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, and customers.

· Must be capable of working in a Laboratory Test Facility around loud equipment.

· Ability to travel when required.

· History of regular and consistent attendance at work.

Preferred:

· Ph.D. Degree in Engineering with experience in product development, risk management, critical design and optimization analysis, the conceptualization of solutions involving novelty, and solving of previously unaddressed challenges not achieved by others in the industry.

· Experience in cross-functional project management education or training.

Rheem is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Notice to Third Party Recruitment Agencies:

Please note that Rheem and its subsidiaries do not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of an executed Recruitment Services Agreement, there will be no obligation to any referral compensation or recruiter fee.

Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, will become the property of Rheem.

Guidewire Business Systems Analyst

Job Posting

General Summary:

NLC is a mutual insurance company which has been writing property and casualty insurance in New England for over 150 years.

We are a progressive company seeking an energetic and skilled Guidewire Business Systems Analyst. Candidate will be responsible to: identify business needs, analyze the change, provide development support, and test Insurance software changes, enhancements, and solutions. Work with end user community to develop and document business requirements for NLC systems. Develop specifications and coordinate efforts of developers. Support testing through creation of test plans, coordination of testing resources and execution of tests conditions. Throughout the process, work with the project team to ensure the requirements are delivered, while supporting and communicating with the business through the implementation process. This role is based in our company’s Norwich, CT location.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities:

· Work directly with business users (Customer Service, Billing, Underwriting, Product and Claims) to understand business processes, gather & document requirements to implement system changes that meet business needs

· Performs comprehensive discovery and analysis activities to develop new or modified system requirements.

· Develop Use Cases, Functional Requirements, Screen Specs, Mockups, Process flows, and User Manuals

· Lead the review of specifications, user sign off procedures and the development of documentation for development and enhancement work.

· Interface with departments to ensure proper features are incorporated in all system changes. Provide user support, documentation and training during project implementation as well as ongoing maintenance support.

· Develop test plans and test schedules to ensure accuracy of systems as requested by end users; coordinate testing efforts in the Quality Assurance environment until user acceptance is obtained. Perform or assist as necessary in the quality assurance testing of developed projects.

· Assist in the coordination testing, training and implementation of system changes. Participate where appropriate.

· Monitor daily migrations to Quality Assurance function.

· Conduct post-production implementation reviews.

· Providing support to analyze production issues from business perspective

· Facilitate development with third party vendors when external resources are engaged, providing the same services utilized in internal development, including specification development, testing strategies, and implementation management.

· Participate as a member of the help desk team in supporting internal and external users in the use of the NLC systems and any specific requests for information from staff and agents.

Qualifications, Experience and Skills:

To qualify for this position you MUST have these required qualifications:

· Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent experience

· 3+ years professional experience as a business systems analyst in an agile project environment

· 3+ years of property and casualty insurance experience with emphasis on personal lines and business owners lines of business

· Experience with Guidewire InsuranceSuite software; Version 8 or above for all three centers (Policy Center, Billing Center, Claims Center) a plus

· Experience with Consumer and Agent facing portals

· Experience with Jira or similar project management tool

· Technical proficiency, with the ability to understand data flows and the flow between complex, integrated systems

· Outstanding organizational, troubleshooting, and communication skills, both written and verbal, in both technical and non-technical forums

· Able to effectively work with remote users via Teams/Zoom/WebEx other virtual collaboration tools

· Able to work in a fast-paced environment with flexibility to meet continuously changing priorities

· Able to multitask, meet deadlines and stay calm under pressure

· Highly motivated self-starter; able to work independently

· Experience collaborating with Development and QA teams in a process-oriented organization

Disclaimer: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by Guidewire Business Systems Analyst described by this job description. They are not attended to be constructed as an exhaustive list of all job responsibilities, duties and skills required of Guidewire Business Systems Analysts so described.

Job ID: J-00288070
Introduction to the job

Join ASML Wilton today to receive your sign on bonus and relocation.

*Offer valid for Wilton, CT new hire offers made between now and December 31, 2023.

ASML US brings together the most creative minds in science and technology to develop lithography machines that are key to producing faster, cheaper, more energy-efficient microchips. We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, the Netherlands, and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in Chandler, Arizona, San Jose and San Diego, California, Wilton, Connecticut, and Hillsboro, Oregon.

Do you want to enable data driven decision making in a manufacturing environment?

Do you possess a keen eye for detail as well as a birds eye view on the production process?

Do you have the ambition to build world class analytical solutions to drive ASML towards industry 4.0?

Then you are the candidate we are looking for to join the Business Engineering team as Manufacturing Data Analyst!

Please apply and challenge us to hire YOU !

This position requires access to controlled technology, as defined in the Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R. § 730, et seq.). Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require ASML to proceed with candidates who are immediately eligible to access controlled technology.

Role and responsibilities

You will have strong stakeholder management skills both towards internal customers and internal suppliers.

You are able to translate internal customer demands into concrete requirements.

You develop quality reports to make the performance of factory processes transparent, translating data into actionable insights following agreed timelines.

You focus on customer experience, maintainability and automation of your analytical solutions.

Collaborate across sectors to define, develop, and implement structural reporting that supports long-term business objectives.

Be a Mentor/Coach within the team for more junior level team members

Provide data-driven analysis to support identification of patterns in product deviations.

In this position you will be able to further develop your analytical skills, business perspective, influencing skills, presenting techniques and project management capabilities.

There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You will have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.

Education and experience

BS degree in Data Science, Analytics, Engineering, Business, Finance, Computer Science or equivalent education experience.

Minimum of 4+ years of working experience as a Data Analyst/Analytics Developer including experience building Analytical products for internal consumption(E.g. Dashboards, automatic analysis, algorithms,).

Experienced with IT-systems in the area of production-control, preferably with Spotfire, Tableau, Power BI (Excel, SAP, SAP ME/BO, SAP HANA ), SQL.

Experience with advanced analytics (e.g. Process Mining, Machine Learning, AI, Imagine recognition, etc) or Industry 4.0 concepts (Digital twin, IOT, predictive/prescriptive manufacturing) preferred.

Skilled with internal stakeholder management.

Experience within a manufacturing environment or semi-conductor industry including ASML experience is a plus.

Experience with Scrum/Agile way of working is advantageous.

Skills

Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.

To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:

Can observe and respond to people and situations and interact with others encountered in the course of work.

Can learn and apply new information or skills.

Must be able to read and interpret data, information, and documents.

Strong customer focus and commitment to customer satisfaction through prioritization, quality, efficiency and professionalism.

Ability to complete assignments with attention to detail and high degree of accuracy.

Proven ability to perform effectively in a demanding environment with changing workloads and deadlines.

Result driven-demonstrate ownership and accountability.

Identifies bottlenecks and drives improvements.

Work independently or as part of a team and follow through on assignments with minimal supervision.

Demonstrate open, clear, concise and professional communication.

Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with manager, co-workers and customer.

Work according to a strict set of procedures within the provided timelines.

Strong analytical skills and ambition to keep developing these.

Self-starter that shows high drive, creativity, ambition and accountability.

Growth mindset: you believe in continuous learning by dedication of time, effort and energy.

Strong communication skills, able to align with all levels in the organization.

Strong customer focus and commitment to customer satisfaction through prioritization, quality, efficiency and professionalism.

Job ID: J-00286748

Introduction

ASML US, including its affiliates and subsidiaries, bring together the most creative minds in science and technology to develop lithography machines that are key to producing faster, cheaper, more energy-efficient microchips. We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, Netherlands, and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in Chandler, Arizona, San Jose and San Diego, California, Wilton, Connecticut, and Hillsboro, Oregon.

Context of the Position

The IT department in the US supports two major factories located in Connecticut and California that each develop and manufacture complex assemblies that require a coordinated supply chain, build plan and ultimately international shipment for final integration at ASML’s Global Headquarters in Veldhoven NL. These functions rely on various SAP modules and related processes and tooling to ensure alignment, visibility and core business functions. Additionally, we support processes and applications that are used in the Customer Support and Finance organizations locally as well as distributed in the US. We work closely with other IT colleagues in the US and globally to provide a single point of contact for our local business partners whenever possible.

Job Mission

The Lead Business Process Analyst is the primary IT point of contact working with all levels of management and subject matter experts in their primary functional area across multiple domains. This individual would ensure that any local or regional initiative is assessed against global architecture and strategies in order to leverage consistent solutions if at all possible. The individual would regularly be expected to assess and develop detailed requirements and drive scoping discussions to help IT and Business Management determine appropriate solutions. The candidate would also clarify with their business partner the expected benefits, change impact and relative priority of any implementation proposed. Once approved, the solution will be crafted through process improvement, application configuration or a combination of methods in close collaboration with business partners and possibly, external service providers. The deliverable will typically include change management that requires clear communication, documentation and possibly training in order to deliver full value.

This position requires access to controlled technology, as defined in the Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R. § 730, et seq.). Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require ASML to proceed with candidates who are immediately eligible to access controlled technology.

Job Description

Ensures the capture of clear expectations and requirements between IT and the Business for all IT related demand.
Expected to inform and educate business partners and IT colleagues with strategic alignment relative to local needs.
Applies industry best practices whenever possible given practical constraints and will advocate for continuous improvement in technical and process optimization.
Serves as the primary contact for the business to advise/solve or direct IT issues for resolution.
Manages escalation of project issues to the appropriate management staff.
Administers and maintains service level agreements between IT and the Business.
Facilitates the alignment of IT projects with business goals and objectives leveraging approved architecture and solutions.
Interacts with the supported business function to develop detailed understanding of user Information Technology needs.
Confers with technical or functional experts at all levels, company-wide, to obtain requirements, develop solution proposals, and coordinate implementation.
Proactively seeks opportunities that will support business goals and provide business users with alternatives that enhance business performance and efficiency.
Develops solution proposals and designs to meet customer requirements.
Facilitates communications with business customer through all phases of this process.
Actively surveys internal customers for feedback, and adjusts activities accordingly.
Manages, sets priorities of, and successfully completes multiple projects and support issues concurrently with little or no supervision of the work group manager.
Mentors and assists in the development of the local and global team members in concert with the work group manager.
Embraces the opportunity to model ASML’s Core Values in all working relationships.

Education

Bachelor’s degree in business administration/management, IS&T Management, Computer Science, or related discipline at a minimum. Advanced degree and/or industry certifications would be preferred. Relevant experience can compensate for lack of ideal degree.

Experience

Minimum of 10 years IT Industry experience in a manufacturing environment.
Experience with functional and technical aspects of major enterprise business systems such as SAP Applications or business intelligence analytical applications. Proficient understanding of the functional capabilities and configuration of broad areas of these applications is required.
Requires thorough understanding of planning, analysis, and testing techniques required to support an enterprise business system.
Experience in multiple functional business areas such as manufacturing, logistics, field service or sales and marketing.
Requires understanding of capabilities, features, and limitations of system development tools.
Demonstrated ability to act in a consultative role to understand functional business processes, related information technology needs, and develop solutions and delivery proposals.

Personal skills

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Excellent customer service skills, with an advanced understanding of customer relationship building.
Ability to use MS Office applications, collaboration tools, and effective use of e-mail and messaging systems.
Ability to effectively manage multiple assignments and priorities.

Other information

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee routinely is required to sit; walk; talk; hear; use hands to keyboard, finger, handle, and feel; stoop, kneel, crouch, twist, reach, and stretch.
The employee is occasionally required to move around the campus.
The employee may occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 pounds.
May require travel dependent on business needs up to 20%.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.
Can work under deadlines.
The environment generally is moderate in temperature and noise level.

Join us to discover a culture that is rooted in innovation and thrives on collaboration. Imagine loving what you do and where you do it.

What Is in It for You?

Health Insurance: Employees and their eligible family members – including spouses, domestic partners, and children – are eligible for coverage from the first day of employment.
Retirement: Travelers matches your 401(k) contributions dollar-for-dollar up to your first 5% of eligible pay, subject to an annual maximum. If you have student loan debt, you can enroll in the Paying it Forward Savings Program. When you make a payment toward your student loan, Travelers will make an annual contribution into your 401(k) account. You are also eligible for a Pension Plan that is 100% funded by Travelers.
Paid Time Off: Start your career at Travelers with a minimum of 20 days Paid Time Off annually, plus nine paid company Holidays.
Wellness Program: The Travelers wellness program is comprised of tools and resources that empower you to achieve your wellness goals. In addition, our Life Balance program provides access to professional counseling services, life coaching and other resources to support your daily life needs. Through Life Balance, you’re eligible for five free counseling sessions with a licensed therapist.
Volunteer Encouragement: We have a deep commitment to the communities we serve and encourage our employees to get involved. Travelers has a Matching Gift and Volunteer Rewards program that enables you to give back to the charity of your choice.

Job Title: IMI CIB - Business Analyst Financial Sponsors Group - New York Branch
Job Description:
Intesa Sanpaolo is the banking group leader in Italy. Assisting more than 14,6 milion of retail customers through a network of 5360 branches, it significantly supports the development of Companies and gives an important sustain to the country's growth. The Group has a selected retail banking presence in Central and Eastern Europe, the Middle East and North Africa, with approximately 1,000 branches and 7.2 million customers in 12 countries. Intesa Sanpaolo is also present in 25 countries in support of its corporate customers’ cross-border business. It is looking for new qualified profiles who want to face demanding and challenging career path with the following requirements:

Scope and Purpose

In support of the Global Relationship Manager (GRM) Financial Sponsors International, the Business Analyst will:

Support the GRM in all tasks related to developing new and expanding existing relationships with Private Equity clients
Perform due diligence on PE clients, fund structures, acquisition targets, industries, and other relevant information as required
Prepare PE and company profiles and pitches
Support in the identification of business opportunities and cross-selling of Intesa Sanpaolo’s financial products and services
Accompany and support the GRM in meeting with clients, in negotiating and structuring transactions
Manage multiple transactions/projects and communicate effectively with deal team members on status and prioritization
Coordinate between and establish strong working partnerships and routines with key internal partners including Leveraged Finance, Fund Finance, Syndication, Debt Capital Markets, Credit, Risk, Industry Verticals, KYC and Legal
Support the preparation of credit applications for LBO and fund finance deals, portfolio summaries and reviews
Perform specific administrative and operative activities related to customer onboarding and management
Demonstrate knowledge of relevant credit policies and procedures and accurately identify policy exceptions
Ensure the Branch’s KYC (Know Your Customers) and CDD (Customers Due Diligence) procedures and directives are adhered to.

The salary range for this job offer would be $ 85,000 - $ 110,000

Required Experience

Ideally 2- 3 years of work experience in a Leveraged Finance, Sponsor Coverage or Capital Markets role
Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Word and PowerPoint)
Experience with Bloomberg, SEC filings, rating agency reports, and equity research reports is a plus.

Competencies Required

Good understanding of Leveraged Buyout (“LBO”) transactions and Private Equity (“PE”) fund structures
Knowledge of the Syndicated Loan Market
Strong quantitative and analytical skills, with the ability to understand and analyze syndicated deal structures and loan documentation
Familiarity with commercial, corporate and investment banking products
Resourceful self-starter, with willingness to learn, superior attention to detail, professional demeanour, and ability to work effectively on multiple projects
Teamwork attitude, with ability to interact and build healthy working relations in a culturally diverse environment
Excellent communication skills
Fluency in English

Required Qualifications, Skills and Knowledge

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or Business Administration, with an emphasis on Corporate Finance, Financial Accounting or Economics

FUNCTION: The primary objective of the Business Analyst I role is to assist the business in implementing non-technological and technological solutions in a cost-effective and efficient manner by determining the requirements of a project or program, and communicating them clearly to senior leaders, stakeholders, facilitators and partners. Utilizing various techniques and practices and following a natural progression from the general to the specific they take high level business problems and objectives and decompose them into requirements that represent functions and attributes of a system or solution. In addition, the Business Analyst I is responsible for the progression of rolling up symptoms and side effects of business problems into higher-level root causes and problem statements while managing the resolution/project from inception to closure.


GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF DUTIES:



Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis.
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.
Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver the following artifacts as needed: (Functional requirements, Business Requirements Documents, Testing Scenarios and Test Plan creation, Business flows and Use Cases).
Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously
Drive and challenge business units on their assumptions of how they will successfully execute their plans.
Strong analytical and product/project management skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into system and operational requirements.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts.
Serves as the conduit between the customer community (internal and external customers), Operations and technical teams through which requirements flow.
Develop requirements specifications according to standard templates, using natural language.
Collaborate with technical resources and subject matter experts to establish the technical/operational vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs.
Be the liaison between the business units, technology teams and support teams.
Assist in the role of the Project Manager for Operations initiated projects and perform the functions of a Project Manager to include:
Successfully delivering the objectives and benefits the Project sponsor expects of the project.
Progress – deliverables are being completed within the baselined time scales.
Cost – deliverables are being completed with the baselined cost plan.
Quality – deliverables are being completed to defined expectations, first time.
Performance – the team is performing and meeting all tasks assigned. Positive team management.
Regulatory – all required statutory and regulatory conditions are being met.
Reporting – regular and timely reporting of project progress to the Sponsor and Project Management Committee and all stakeholders.
Risk – proactively manage foreseen project risk, mitigating as necessary.
Change – managing changes to the project without unduly affecting the stated objectives and benefits.
Project Definition creation and agreement with Project Sponsor
Project Terms of reference – identify, agree and document responsibilities and expectations of the Project Sponsor.
Additional duties include: Produce a progress report on an agreed upon frequency (weekly, monthly, etc.), review the risks for the project and report out on them, facilitate communication meetings with the project team, review weekly progress reports on the project for larger initiatives from WorkStream lead, induct new team members into the team, market and champion the project internally in the organization and maintain issues lists and project plan updates, etc.
Maintains a sound understanding of the Bank’s internal policies and banking regulations such as Reg E, Reg O, Reg CC and Reg D. Follows all internal and external policies, procedures, regulations and service level agreements.
Provides backup to the Fiserv Core and Vendor Administrator.
Perform other duties as assigned.


DIGITAL LITERACY:
The ability to use data, information, and communication technologies to find, evaluate, create, and communicate information, requiring both cognitive and technical skills.


Information, data, and content
Teaching learning and self-development
Communication, collaboration, and participation
Digital identity, safety, and security
Technical proficiency with all bank products
Awareness and interest in new technology
Creation, innovation, and research


FUNCTION SUPERVISED: None

LIST OF POSITIONS SUPERVISED: None

EDUCATION REQUIRED: A college degree (BS or BA in a relevant field).

MANAGERIAL RESPONSIBILITY: Has no supervisory/managerial responsibilities.

EXPERIENCE REQUIRED: One to three years of similar or related experience. Proficiency in related bank regulations, specifically Regulation E, Regulation O, Regulation CC, Regulation D, BSA, NACHA Operating Rules and Visa rules and regulations is helpful. The ability to interpret reports and think creatively about solutions for new products, existing product integration and new programs/projects is critical. Must demonstrate a willingness to learn in an evolving department. Must be proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint.


Compensation: Compensation is based on our market pay structures. However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to business considerations, local market conditions, and internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications, such as skills, education, and experience.

GSB is an equal opportunity employer and offers equal opportunity to all applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, and veteran status.

Applicants requiring reasonable accommodation in the application process should notify Human Resources.

Development, analysis and deployment of revenue cycle reports for a variety of department and leadership levels across the health system. Performs development, implementation and resolution to software and hardware requirements, acting as liaison between the department and MIS department when required. Creates professional billing material based on validated data and identified trends to provide training across entities to optimize the success of the revenue cycle, This position requires strong organizational and communication skills. Ensures positive interactions with patients, family members, medical staff, and co-workers. Essential duties and responsibilities include the following.

EEO/AA/Disability/Veteran Responsibilities:
1. Provides appropriate reports and statistical data to other department designees for review, follow-up and resolution. This includes summarizing and reporting to department leadership, staff and operational staff to optimize revenue opportunity.
2. Responsible for design, development and maintenance of reports. Utilizes system analytics tools such as report writer or vendor applications. Validates and interprets data to provide recommendations to management. Develops innovative and viable solutions.
3. Identifies and monitors trends in accounts receivable and recommends opportunities to improve revenue through maintaining and distributing reports
4. Maintains high level of understanding of all department systems components and functionalities. Perform programming, analysis and support as needed. Validates system functionality and ensures any changes have the intended results.

9. Identifies and monitors trends in revenue cycle to identify deficiencies and assess effectiveness of overall training effort. Collaborates with others to develop programs to enhance staff knowledge base
10. Communicates department metrics and revenue cycle activity to meet the business requirements of department and operational staff, as well as executive level leadership.
11. Discloses healthcare billing updates to both the department staff and practice operations to optimize the success of the revenue cycle.
12. Demonstrates exceptional customer service toward internal and external customers
13. Attends training programs, in-service and staff meetings as required or recommended to increase technical expertise. This may include specialized systems training (i.e. EPIC Super User).
14. Perform other duties as assigned.

EDUCATION




Associate's degree in healthcare or a business related field required. Bachelor's Degree is preferred. CPB or CPC preferred.




EXPERIENCE




Three (3) to five (5) years' work experience in healthcare revenue cycle setting or Two (2) to three (3) years' experience with PC software, programming and report writer.




SPECIAL SKILLS




Strong analytical and communication skills. Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office products. Proficient understanding of medical health insurance billing practices and terminology. High level revenue cycle knowledge. Certificate of Completion for Business Objects Web Intelligence Report Developer required within 12 months. EPIC certification opportunity.

Job Description:
The Business Systems Analyst position is part of the Data, Technology and Engineering (DTE) team, supporting Quality Systems and Vertex Innovation and External Research (VIER). This position is responsible for supporting and enhancing Vertex’s Learning Management SAAS solution provided by Cornerstone on Demand.

As Vertex works to build and enhance our existing system, we are seeking an individual who will help us research, configure, test, and document solutions to issues identified by our business stakeholders. This individual will partner with other Subject Matter Experts, both internally and via third parties. They will help us ensure that we provide a system that meets the compliance needs demanded in a validated environment while continuing to enhance Vertex’s learning ecosystem via the Learning Advancement Program.

Qualified candidates will have:
Cornerstone (or similar LMS technical experience)
GxP validation experience
System Administration, integration, and configuration experience

*** this role will not include the creating or assigning of training content ***

Key Responsibilities:
Participate in day-to-day project and support work, including analysis, documentation, configuration, testing, integration, and reporting activities.
Conduct systems analysis and configuration changes in accordance with industry Systems Lifecycle (SLC) and Vertex Change Management guidelines for a validated environment
Implement product enhancements; understand and document business processes and requirements
Manage customer support cases via case management tool
Participate in reviewing, planning, testing and implementing regularly scheduled system upgrades
Develop collaborative relationships with IT peers, Talent Management, Quality Systems, external partners, and various operational teams to help design, develop, and deliver learning solutions that satisfy business requirements
Translate technically complex analysis into easily comprehensible terms
Ensure data integrity including quality, accuracy, security, and usability of employee data and related interfaces by adhering to established processes and controls

Minimum Qualifications/EXPERIENCE
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or other technical discipline
Minimum 3 years of relevant experience
Demonstrate the ability to quickly learn new tools based on conceptual understanding of technology
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
Flexibility to adapt to a continually changing and fast paced business environment
Effective communications and presentation skills
Demonstrate an understanding of good project management practices as well as the fundamentals of the System Lifecyle (SLC) and Information Technology operational practices
Familiar with Microsoft Office products (e.g. Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote)
Experience administering Cornerstone on Demand preferred
Experience with Learning Management Systems preferred
Pharmaceutical industry experience including GxP requirements preferred
Proficiency leveraging analytical languages and tools preferred (e.g. SQL, PowerBI)
Pay Range:
$80-$90/hr

Welcome to Pryon, a place for people who want to define the state of the art: real AI (oxymoron intended), developed by real pioneers, solving real problems of consequence. Our company was built by some of the most well-known experts in the field, whose DNA lives on in Alexa, Siri, Watson, and virtually every other AI product on the market. But the best part of the story is still to come: We’re creating a world-class culture fueled by intellectual curiosity and radical technology — to reduce the distance between knowledge and people.

We’re a team of AI, tech, and language experts whose DNA lives in Alexa, Siri, Watson, and virtually every human language technology product on the market. Now we’re building an industry-leading knowledge management platform. Our proprietary, cutting-edge natural language processing capabilities transform unstructured data into meaningful experiences that increase productivity with unmatched accuracy and speed.

Pryon is searching for a talented business analyst to be a pivotal player in driving data-backed decision-making and optimizing the operational performance of our organization. You will report into the office of the COO as a part of our Centralized Operations Organization. Your primary responsibility will be to gather, analyze, and interpret key performance indicators (KPIs) and other relevant metrics, providing actionable insights that enhance operational efficiency, customer experience, and overall business performance.
In This Role, You Will:
Develop business intelligence (BI) gathering best practices and the management of data and information
Monitor and analyze operational performance metrics, process efficiency, and resource utilization to identify trends and opportunities for improvement
Deliver accurate and timely reports to management regarding quantitative goals attainment
Provides relevant communication, ad-hoc research, and analyses as well as early warnings and long-term trends to support the positioning strategies
Coordinate with decision makers in the company to ensure that information gathering and analysis support the overall development of business strategies
Lead continuous improvement activities and implementation of new business initiatives
Focus on enabling Operations and Shared Services Leaders to make data driven decisions
What You'll Need to Be Successful:
Our ideal candidate has 3-5 years of combined experience in business intelligence, insights and analytics within a software organization; working in a SaaS environment preferred
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university
Proven experience building a BI program from the ground up across multiple operational areas (i.e., R&D, Back-Office, Customer Experience, Sales & Marketing,)
Strong analytical skills that enable you to effectively leverage the wealth of data and insights at Pryon
Experience with AI / LLM technologies and understanding the data behind them is preferred
Experience working with global teams in the area of business intelligence
In-depth knowledge in some (or most of) the following tools: Domo, PowerBI, Tableau, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Access
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, R, or similar programming languages.
Extraordinary organizational skills with the ability to work cross functionally with other stakeholders, as well as senior global leadership
The ability to meet deadlines in a fast‑paced, growth environment
Exemplary interpersonal, analytical and communications skills

Job Title: Sales Data and Business Intelligence Analyst
Job Description:
Date: Nov 17, 2023

Location: Shelton, CT, US, 06484-4300

Company: Hubbell Incorporated

Corporate Overview
Hubbell Incorporated was founded in 1888 and has grown into an international manufacturer of quality electrical, lighting and power solutions with more than 75 brands used and recognized around the world. Our founder, Harvey Hubbell, developed tooling and equipment to serve the growing demand for new assembly and manufacturing machinery during the industrial revolution. An early, and one of many patents awarded, came for the creation of the first practical method to control electricity through the pull chain socket that remains unchanged today. As a market leader in reliable, electrical solutions, we provide more than half a million products delivered through our various business groups. Hubbell is committed to continually innovating solutions that work, transforming old products with new ideas, and ensuring that we Energize, Enlighten and Empower the communities that support us.
Position Overview
The Business Analyst will be responsible for supporting the HES C&I Sales Organization leadership team in market-based reporting, forecasting, business analytics, business planning, performance analysis, market intelligence and salesforce effectiveness. The individual will manage multiple strategic initiatives focused on optimized internal business processes including reporting and forecasting; helping to maintain and grow market position; and drive continuous improvement in Commercial Excellence platforms. This role will report to the VP, Commercial Excellence.

Duties and Responsibilities
Monthly reporting process
Monthly forecasting process
Monthly market performance analytics
Monthly C&I sales, rep agency and distributor dashboards for regular tracking of key metrics
Support vertical market and contractor team pilots with data analysis to identify opportunities
Develop macro trends by market, geography, application, etc.
End market analysis to support overall business objectives
Identifying micro level trend interactions within regions (i.e. – project wins, NPD feedback, distributor alignment shifts)
Conduct market research and competitive analysis in development of new potential markets
Support strategic planning efforts, quota setting process, and business development opportunities
Skills and Experience
Bachelor’s degree in business, engineering, finance, or marketing
Minimum of three years with CRM systems (Salesforce.com preferred)
Minimum of three years of data analysis and systems experience
Experience with SAP is a plus
MBA is a plus
Travel as required up to 20%
Relevant Industries


Hubbell Incorporated, its subsidiaries and affiliates, is an EO Employer AA: M/F/Veteran/Disability. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other protected class.

Who Are We?
Taking care of our customers, our communities and each other. That’s the Travelers Promise. By honoring this commitment, we have maintained our reputation as one of the best property casualty insurers in the industry for over 160 years. Join us to discover a culture that is rooted in innovation and thrives on collaboration. Imagine loving what you do and where you do it.
Job Category
Technology
Compensation Overview
The annual base salary range provided for this position is a nationwide market range and represents a broad range of salaries for this role across the country. The actual salary for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. As part of our comprehensive compensation and benefits program, employees are also eligible for performance-based cash incentive awards.
Salary Range
$75,500.00 - $124,600.00
Target Openings
2
What Is the Opportunity?
Under general supervision, the Business Systems Analyst is responsible for working with stakeholders to elicit, analyze, specify and validate business and solution requirements to meet business needs. Must be able to work with a diverse stakeholder group, identify areas of contention and create a shared understanding between the customer community and the solution delivery team while maintaining alignment with Business and IT Strategies. The Business Systems Analyst is able to successfully transition to unfamiliar business and systems domains with minimal guidance. This job typically does not lead others. May act as a team lead on small to medium sized initiatives. The Business Systems Analyst may provide limited coaching to less experienced analysts.
What Will You Do?
Responsible for the success of the Requirements Definition Process for assigned work with general supervision;.
Elicit, analyze, specify and communicate business, system and implementation requirements.
Ensure the requirements are unambiguous and understandable by both business users and solution delivery teams.
Work with stakeholders to prioritize requirements effectively based on business value, risks and constraints.
Effectively communicate requirements conflicts to project leads, assist with conflict resolution.
Ensure that requirements are understood and approved by all stakeholders.
Manage requirement traceability and changes throughout the project lifecycle.
Ensure the test strategy and test plans adequately cover the requirements. Assist in defect resolution.
Measures and tracks quality of business analysis work.
Participate in determining how requirements will be approached and managed for a particular project following enterprise and division best practices.
Work with project leads to develop requirements work plans, identify task dependencies, develop estimates and determine resource skill requirements; support risk management and change management activities.
Identify, refine, and accurately articulate the business objectives and value proposition of assigned initiatives. Bring alternative perspectives and influence consensus among stakeholders.
Effectively verifies and validates requirements; ensures that all requirements support the delivery of business value, fulfills goals and objectives, and meets a stakeholder need.
Continuously strive to improve understanding of requirements techniques, processes and deliverables required to support successful project delivery. Embrace feedback and opportunities for process improvement.
Simultaneously support multiple initiatives as assigned.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Perform other duties as assigned.
What Will Our Ideal Candidate Have?
Three years of experience in Business Systems or equivalent preferred.
Bachelors degree in Business, MIS, or other related field preferred.
Experience with Agile Ceremonies
Proficient with MS Suite ( Word, PowerPoint, Excel)
Analytical Thinking (Intermediate):
Identifies current or future problems or opportunities, analyzes, synthesize and compares information to understand issues, identifies cause/effect relationships and explores alternative solutions to support sound decision making.
Facilitation (Intermediate):
Uses and adjusts style and technique to assist group process and understanding.
Communication (Intermediate):
Demonstrates effective verbal, written, and listening communication skills.
Teamwork (Intermediate):
Works together in situations when actions are interdependent and a team is mutually responsible to produce a result.
Relationship Management (Intermediate):
Seeks out, builds, fosters and maintains productive relationships, networks or alliances to meet goals and achieve results.
Business Perspective (Intermediate):
Uses knowledge of internal and external factors impacting the property casualty industry to make decisions.
Technology (Basic):
Uses, leverages and maintains proficiency with corporate and job specific technology as it evolves (e.g., hardware, software, business unit applications and systems tools).
Conflict Management (Basic):
Brings conflicts into the open and resolves them collaboratively.
Change Management / Resilience (Intermediate):
Remains energized and focused in the face of ambiguity, change or strenuous demands.
Risk Taking (Basic): Identifies, assesses, manages and takes intelligent risks to attain objectives
None
What is a Must Have?
One year of experience in Business Systems or equivalent required
High school diploma or equivalent required.
What Is in It for You?
Health Insurance: Employees and their eligible family members – including spouses, domestic partners, and children – are eligible for coverage from the first day of employment.
Retirement: Travelers matches your 401(k) contributions dollar-for-dollar up to your first 5% of eligible pay, subject to an annual maximum. If you have student loan debt, you can enroll in the Paying it Forward Savings Program. When you make a payment toward your student loan, Travelers will make an annual contribution into your 401(k) account. You are also eligible for a Pension Plan that is 100% funded by Travelers.
Paid Time Off: Start your career at Travelers with a minimum of 20 days Paid Time Off annually, plus nine paid company Holidays.
Wellness Program: The Travelers wellness program is comprised of tools and resources that empower you to achieve your wellness goals. In addition, our Life Balance program provides access to professional counseling services, life coaching and other resources to support your daily life needs. Through Life Balance, you’re eligible for five free counseling sessions with a licensed therapist.
Volunteer Encouragement: We have a deep commitment to the communities we serve and encourage our employees to get involved. Travelers has a Matching Gift and Volunteer Rewards program that enables you to give back to the charity of your choice.
Employment Practices
Travelers is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that we can deliver the very best products and services when our workforce reflects the diverse customers and communities we serve. We are committed to recruiting, retaining and developing the diverse talent of all of our employees and fostering an inclusive workplace, where we celebrate differences, promote belonging, and work together to deliver extraordinary results.

We are Subway Headquarters! A dedicated team of professionals supporting thousands of franchisees around the globe.

The Systems Analyst II is a position within the Internal Consulting team across business analysis, system analysis, and process consulting job families. Systems Analyst II have some industry and technology experience, but are not independent practitioners. They support Senior Systems Analysts or BSA Managers on the project workstreams. Majority of the work activities are delivery focused e.g. requirements gathering workshops, documentation, test script development etc. Systems Analyst II should have strong analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills. They should also have the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.

Essential Functions:

Liase with internal and external customers to gather, document and analyze detailed business / system / product requirements needed by Technology teams to deliver projects.
Identify gaps in requirements and following up with stakeholders to resolve gaps, communicate requirements clearly using a variety of formats (e.g., user stories, acceptance criteria, functional"
Develop technical, functional, and strategic artifacts such as solution diagrams, business requirements, and business cases to support delivery of the projects across the SDLC.
Become a subject matter expert in the Subway ecosystem and develop the ability to explain technical concepts in simple terms to business stakeholders.
Plan, prioritize and manage project scope and product feature backlog and development of requirements and user stories where appropriate.
Work closely with internal and external customers and stakeholders, including any third parties to gather business requirements and define software functionality, throughout the release lifecycle, from inception to general release to ongoing support. May also work with internal and/or external development teams and vendor partners to deliver project objectives.
Support the project and program managers to ensure that the projects are delivered on budget and on time
Contribute to the Internal Consulting practice development initiatives such as training, intellectual capital development, benchmarking, training, and recruiting etc.
Validate all requirements, stories meet acceptance criteria, has the appropriate acceptance tests and accept requirements and stories as appropriate only if it passes all validations
Adapt to changing expectations and project demands. Develop a client first mindset. Become well versed in the internal consulting methodology and frameworks. Be flexible to be utilized >90%.

Company Name: Constitution Billing and Financial Services LLC
Job Description:
Business Intelligence Analyst




Location: 100 Avon Meadow Lane Avon, CT 06001

Salary Range: $70,000 - $80,000




Who we are:

Constitution Billing and Financial Services, LLC (CBFS), offers in-depth knowledge of healthcare accounting, finance and revenue cycle management. Our management team has developed long term relationships with several major hospitals and providers throughout southern New England. These relationships uniquely position CBFS to perform its core function of financial oversight and revenue cycle management.




Overview:

The BI Analyst will be a business partner with the Operations, Finance, Marketing, Business Development and various other team members to initiate and implement innovative concepts within business processes utilizing Tableau, Alteryx, and SQL Server.




The analyst is responsible for the strategic design and maintenance of business intelligence applications. Identifies, researches, and resolves technical problems. Ensures that the use of business intelligence applications enhances business decision making capabilities. Familiar with a variety of the field's concepts, practices, and procedures. Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. This individual will perform analytical and technical tasks to develop advanced reporting solutions with Tableau being the Reporting/Dashboard Tool.




Duties/Responsibilities:

Gathers business intelligence from a variety of sources including company data, industry and field reports, public information, or purchased sources.
Uses business intelligence data and tools to identify and monitor current and potential customers.
Refines existing dashboards to driver further user adoption.
Identifies markets for future business development and methods to improve outreach efforts alongside business development team.
Compiles business intelligence or trends to support actionable recommendations.
Maintains current knowledge of industry and business trends through communication with professional organizations, suppliers, customers, and other informed individuals.
Summarizes financial and economic data reports for review by executives, managers, clients, and stakeholders.
Generating and compiling reports on a monthly basis.
Performs other related duties as assigned.

**This position will require in office work in Essex, CT. Relocation assistance not provided. Visa sponsorship is not provided.**

Summary

The Portfolio Optimization Business Analyst plays a critical role in ensuring the integrity of product-related business intelligence and the effectiveness of associated processes that touch virtually all areas of the organization. The Analyst works in a fast-paced, deadline-driven, global business environment, successfully juggling multiple, simultaneous, high-priority projects and processes. S/he: maintains and manages commercial part data integrity to ensure high performing customer experiences and maximize company commercial performance (i.e. price coverage, shelf life data, cross references, etc.). S/he: translates price strategies, contractual and product line requirements into efficient operational processes (i.e. business rule-based automated pricing routines, data structure for new transactions such as surplus, pipeline data, etc.). S/he: provides transactional technical support for customers and Sales (i.e. helpdesk pricing support, technical and data questions, catalog management, etc.). S/he: performs commercial and data analysis to support product line management and new business opportunities. S/he: leads the execution and continuous improvement of key product line management processes (i.e. assortment review, dead stock review, win-rate review). Analysts add core value by taking ownership to offer and drive efficient, innovative, and effective product-related data and process solutions.


Job-Related Knowledge

Market Research
Business deal review, portfolio performance
Design, execute and communicate methodology
Pricing strategy
Advanced MS Office, such as Access and Excel
Power BI
SQL or Automation Analysis
Advanced Math Skills

Experience & Education

Bachelor’s Degree or Equivalent
Required 2-4 Years of Related Work Experience in Business Analytics or Data Science

Who We Are
Proponent is the world’s largest independent aerospace distribution company. Headquartered in Brea CA, Proponent has more than 10 offices around the world. We partner with Suppliers around the globe to offer broad aircraft part solutions to a diverse international customer base. Our mission is to serve as a trusted advisor delivering innovative solutions in an engaging work environment. The Proponent brand means exactly what it says. It’s a brand that champions our customers, suppliers, and employees. We want each of our partners, internal and external, to win.

Proponent takes immense pride in its status as a 100% employee-owned company, also known as an ESOP company. Ownership is ever-present throughout Proponent. A culture of ownership is one where employees feel a substantial, personal stake in the company’s performance. It creates a situation in which behavior is guided more by values than by rules. That means that each of us chooses to walk the walk and champion our values of integrity, agility, empathy, and intelligence.

What We Offer

Employee Stock Ownership Plan
Medical, Dental Vision
9 paid holidays
Dedication to work/life balance
Engaging and active work environment

Job Title: Senior Business Analyst – Strategic IT Collaboration (Hybrid)
Job Description:
Role Overview: Senior Business Analyst – Strategic IT Collaboration

As a Senior Business Analyst in our dynamic organization, you will be at the forefront of driving innovation, fostering collaboration between business and IT, and influencing the strategic direction of our technological landscape. Your role will encompass a range of responsibilities, combining technical acumen with business insight to ensure that our IT solutions not only meet but exceed the evolving needs of our business partners.

Key Responsibilities:

Strategic Partnership: Act as a pivotal liaison, leading discussions and ensuring effective communication between IT and assigned business areas. Your ability to forge strong partnerships will be essential in understanding and aligning IT solutions with the strategic goals of the organization.

Requirement Excellence: Be the driving force behind the meticulous documentation of business requirements. Your role involves anticipating and translating these requirements into comprehensive functional and technical specifications, ensuring a clear roadmap for successful solution delivery.

Innovative Solution Design: Collaborate closely with IT architects and technical experts to craft forward-thinking solutions. Your role as a thought leader will influence and shape IT roadmaps, ensuring that they align seamlessly with the evolving needs of the business.

Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process enhancement and champion change within your assigned business area. Actively contribute to shaping IT and business processes, ensuring continuous improvement and efficiency gains.

Industry Leadership: Stay ahead of industry trends and developments, sharing valuable insights with your team. Actively seek and propose solutions that drive efficiency and excellence in collaboration with other IT team members.

Project Accountability: Take the lead in developing compelling business cases. Ensure alignment with business needs and present these cases to the Project Management Office (PMO) and Finance, showcasing your ability to drive successful project outcomes.

Technical Know-How:

Versatile Expertise: Apply your business and general system knowledge to solve complex business/IT problems. Showcase your ability to quickly learn and adapt to new applications, processes, and procedures.
Adaptability: Demonstrate agility in a dynamic work environment, with exposure to diverse technologies and application development methodologies. Your ability to lead business analysis on large-scale, complex projects will be a key asset.
Collaborative Proficiency: Work effectively within teams, collaborating with both business and technical roles. Influence stakeholders at different management levels, contributing to successful project outcomes.
Innovative Tools: Utilize tools such as Jira, VSTS, and others, showcasing proficiency in both Waterfall and Agile project delivery methodologies.

Qualifications:

Education: Hold a Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience.
Professional Background: Demonstrate 6-10 years of proven application of Business Analysis skills, with prior experience in the utility industry being a significant advantage.
Regulatory Insight: Previous exposure to regulatory projects within a regulated industry is a definite plus.

Join us in this impactful role, where your analytical prowess meets strategic innovation. Be the driving force behind transformative IT solutions and shape the future with us. Apply now and become a key player in our journey towards excellence!

Infosys Public Services is the leader in consulting, technology, and next-generation services. We partner with US and Canadian public sector organizations to help them stay ahead of the innovation curve. Our technology solutions, combined with proven best practices and execution excellence enable our clients to renew themselves and build new capabilities to improve mission outcomes.

We are pushing the limit of what is currently possible – towards completely new areas. And then executing these ideas to perfection.

Currently, we are seeking a Medicaid Business Analyst, to join IPS and become a key member to analyze federal & state Medicaid regulations and support and maintain state integrated eligibility system. You will validate system changes, via test and review processes, ensuring there are no adverse effects, and evaluate the changes to determine whether they meet requirements and function as designed.

Job Description:
Analyze federal and state regulations for Medicaid programs
Perform functional activities to support and maintain an integrated eligibility system
Utilize knowledge of Medicaid eligibility rules to analyze defects, perform root cause analysis, suggest solutions, and verify defect fixes
Review assigned change request documentation and perform impact analysis.
Convert policy requirements into system requirements and functional design
Participate in reviews and walkthroughs of deliverables with the Client.
Review test cases, scenarios, and conditions
Support users in user acceptance testing
4 or more years of experience with State Medicaid eligibility systems operations and/or implementation as a functional consultant or equivalent positions like Business Analyst, Process Analyst, etc.
Functional knowledge of rules, regulations, policies, and procedures in Medicaid.
Experience in translating federal and state policy requirements into functional requirements and functional designs OR experience in reviewing functional requirements and/or functional designs of state eligibility systems for Medicaid programs

Nice to have:
Along with experience in Medicaid eligibility rules, basic knowledge of Food and/or Cash programs like SNAP and TANF is a plus

Educational Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, or foreign equivalent, required from an accredited institution. Will also consider three years of progressive, relevant work experience instead of every year of education. Candidates that have completed a Master’s degree program are strongly preferred.

Required years of experience, training, technical skills, and other requirements for job performance:
4+ years of experience in Medicaid eligibility systems
Excellent verbal and written skills
Proven ability to engage with clients on day-to-day work without supervision

The job may entail an extensive amount of travel. The job also entails sitting as well as working at a computer for extended periods. Should be able to communicate by telephone, email, or face-to-face.

IPS strictly complies with U.S. employment verification and anti-discrimination laws. An applicant hired by IPS must be able to establish authorization to work in the U.S. IPS does not sponsor individuals for U.S. work visas, though exceptions may be evaluated on a case-by-case basis, at the sole discretion of the company.

If you're ready to start building your career with a company dedicated to employing the most talented workforce in the industry, we're ready to speak with you!

O&G Industries, Inc., an innovative and diversified construction company located in Torrington, CT, seeks a Financial Business Analyst to join our team. In our 100th year of business, we are a highly respected leader in our field and ranked as one of the top construction firms in the Northeast.

The Financial Business Analyst must be a highly analytical subject matter expert and work collaboratively across the organization with key stakeholders in a variety of areas. This role will help bridge the gap between the operations, the support functions, and the technical team to manage complex data and technical systems.

You report to the Chief Financial Officer.

The Financial Business Analyst is expected to:

Understand what the business does including, most significantly, the processes through which they accomplish work. This includes an understanding of key systems like JD Edwards or other similar large ERP system
Lead research, design, and manage implementation of new technology, conversions or applications that requires technical understanding. Monitor progress against plan and assist in the development of functional specifications, user testing procedures, and training plan
Troubleshoot issues with data and processes
Assist and educate end users in the effective use of company-wide systems
Translate data and findings from high level technical language into information that stakeholders can understand
Evaluate processes for efficiency, cost, and productivity (positive business results)
Compile recommendations on process adjustments, new potentially impactful technologies, or other areas of improvement
Develop system security rules and administer ongoing security requests
Identify practices or procedures that are not operating at their highest functionality and to formulate and implement relevant solutions
Uncover inconsistencies or inefficiencies in business processes and make actionable suggestions for enhancements

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance or related field
Significant business analyst experience (5 + years)
Significant JD Edwards or equivalent ERP experience
Knowledge of US GAAP accounting principles and financial management.
Proficiency in the use of various software applications, including Microsoft Suite with demonstrated advanced Excel skills
Understanding of the Software Development Lifecycle
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Project management skills
