Job Title: Revenue Cycle Business Analyst / PA Remit Processing
Job Description:
Description

Job Schedule: Full Time
Standard Hours: 40
Job Shift: Shift 1
Shift Details:




Work where every moment matters.

Every day, over 30,000 Hartford HealthCare colleagues come to work with one thing in common: Pride in what we do, knowing every moment matters here. We invite you to become part of Connecticut's most comprehensive healthcare network.

The creation of the HHC System Support Office recognizes the work of a large and growing group of employees whose responsibilities are continually evolving so that we and our departments now work on behalf of the system as a whole, rather than a single member organization.
With the creation of our new umbrella organization we now have our own identity with a unique payroll, benefits, performance management system, service recognition programs and other common practices across the system.

Position Summary:

Create, prepare and maintain a variety of analysis required for revenue cycle leadership. Support process improvement for hospital billing and professional billing revenue cycle, analyze data, and provide recommendations to the Revenue Cycle leadership team.

Position Responsibilities:

Key Areas of Responsibility

1. Maintains a high level understanding of the entire revenue cycle, including Key Performance Indicators (KPIs); maintains a thorough knowledge of the components for which manager is specifically responsible; maintains a thorough knowledge of staff processes; anticipates changes in revenue cycle workflow based on changes in the internal and external healthcare environment relevant to the unit and makes appropriate changes/recommendations.

2. Identifies work processes that can be improved upon, eliminated, or handled through electronic processes; makes appropriate changes or recommendations to workflows; breaks down identified problems into small components, understands underlying issues, simplifies and processes complex issues; understands the difference between critical and unimportant facts/details.

3. Routinely Analyzes revenue cycle data and patient accounts to help identify root-causes to issues affecting cash flow, accounts receivable and net revenue:

Ability to analyze and synthesize data, including recognizing patterns and conceptualizing processes.
Independently identifies resolution on accounts or provides recommendation to manager based on standard work developed by the department.
Identify improvement opportunities (proactive and reactive). Continually strive to improve quality by identifying areas of potential risk and recommending improvement opportunities
Identify, create and support process design changes by conducting business and systems process analysis and design at a complex level. Focusing on operational improvement and data management while ensuring data is reputable and valid. Partner with internal and external customers to ensure system processes provided meet the long-term business strategies
Monitor the EPIC Revenue Cycle Dashboards for any variations and areas of potential risk. Monitor closely the trend in AR Days, unbilled charges, late charges, aging AR and cash collections. Perform detail analysis of discrepancies, report areas of high financial risk and make resolution recommendations to senior management.
Lead projects as assigned to successful, on time completion including effective planning, coordinating the project team, establishing deadlines, and resolving barriers.
Remain cognizant of revenue cycle research, seminars, user groups, other facility ideas and monitor current industry trends for potential application to HHC Revenue Cycle.
Perform trend analysis and key performance indicator (KPI) variances to identify financial risk and opportunities to maximize financial return.

4. Maintain working relationships with vendors (Huron, Experian, PWC, Early-Out and Collection Agencies) and communicates as needed for status updates, data, data validation, reconciliation, etc.

5. Respond to issues identified that impact the financial health of the revenue cycle and need analysis and/or review; escalate issues to leadership as appropriate along with recommended solutions.

6. Recommends policies and standard work that will speed processing of claims payments and reduce the amount of follow up required by the hospital, while incorporating goals and productivity standards.

Working Relationships:

Job Title of Individual(s) Reports To: Manager of Customer Service and Self-Pay

Qualifications

Education

Bachelor's degree in Health Care Management, Business Administration, or related field.
Extensive experience may substitute for education

Experience

Minimum:

o Five (5) years' experience in hospital/professional billing revenue cycle or medical office setting.

o Prior project management experience preferred.

o Strong Excel and/or database skills.

o Strong problem solving and analytical skills.

Preferred:

o Experience developing end user reports.

o Experienced on creating and programming queries.

o Strong database skills (Oracle preferred).

Knowledge, Skills and Ability Requirements:

Ability to create structure and organize teams to work independently
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Demonstrated ability to build and maintain strong and strategic business relationships
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills with the ability to execute with limited information and ambiguity.
Persuasive, collaborative business acumen with the ability to influence others.
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities
Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced working environment
Ability to work comfortably with a variety of stakeholders at multiple organizational levels

We take great care of careers.

With locations around the state, Hartford HealthCare offers exciting opportunities for career development and growth. Here, you are part of an organization on the cutting edge - helping to bring new technologies, breakthrough treatments and community education to countless men, women and children. We know that a thriving organization starts with thriving employees- we provide a competitive benefits program designed to ensure work/life balance. Every moment matters. And this is your moment.

Job Title: Sr. Business Analyst (Hybrid Onsite)

Location: Hartford, CT

Duration: 12 Months

Note: Need locals / Client need US Citizens or Green Card holders as of now.

Must have: Child Welfare or SACWIS program experience

SCOPE OF WORK

The agency needs to engage the service of a Business Analyst.

This consultant will work for the DCF IS CSM and under the supervision of the IT QA Manager as a Business Analyst for current AFCARS(Adoption and Foster Care Analysis and Reporting System), NCANDS, (National Child Abuse and Neglect Data System) NYTD(National Youth in Transition Database), IRS (Internal Revenue Service), along with some IV-E (Title IV-E Foster Care Eligibility). In this position, the consultant will be part of the Federal Reporting team and can facilitate discovery, visioning, leaning, design, and analysis of current and new system. The analyst will document, plan and work to accomplish team goals, lead groups in performing a variety of requirement gathering and agile/hybrid iterative process refinement at the program and portfolio management level, a wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected. Responsibilities will include:

Documentation of the current Business Processes and Automation.

Migration and implementation strategy

Development of request for proposals

Development of Federal plans and reports.

Work with other Connecticut state agencies, contracted third party vendors and federal agencies interfacing with DCF to establish new interface protocols.

Management of business analysis, quality assurance, end user training, and application implementation.

Negotiate with customers; emphasis on business process and user interface

Review requirements; emphasis on functionality and system qualities

Train, mentor other Analysts.

Mediate between Business and other Analysts.

Conduct meetings with Business SME and document business workflow, process.

Analyze workflow and recommend improvements.

Document issues with process, applications, automation.

Maintain documentation up to date and distribute to project team members.

Gather requirements, requests, and meet with team members to discuss solutions.

Negotiate timelines with Business and Development Teams.

Follow up frequently with Business SME on progress.

Address questions, act as liaison between IT and Business.

REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

Refer to the State contracts for IT Professional Services Agreement (12PSX0251) for experience and skill requirements for the job classification Business Analyst to fill the role. In addition, the agency requires:

A minimum of 5 years’ experience demonstrating the following knowledge and skills:

1. Extensive experience and knowledge of Child Welfare, Business Process Mapping, SACWIS, Data Quality, Federal regulations and State regulations.

2. Experience with working with high-level internal and external agency's management.

3. Experience with DCF Development Practices and Methodology.

4. Experience with Lean and Agile methodologies

5. Understanding of the technical and business interdependencies that will exist between the legacy system and the modernized and upgraded application

6. Understanding of legacy Batch systems

7. Experience in the creation of detailed business requirements and business processes to meet the requirements of the next generation CCWIS application

8. Experience with Data Quality and planning and testing of automated CCWIS processes.

9. Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Outlook)

Every day, almost 30,000 Hartford HealthCare employees come to work with one thing in common: Pride in what we do, knowing every moment matters here. We invite you to become part of Connecticut's most comprehensive healthcare network.

Hartford Hospital is one of the largest and most respected teaching hospitals New England. We are a Level 1 Trauma Center that provides cutting edge treatment to its patients. This is made possible by being home to the largest robotic surgery center in the Northeast and the Center for Education, Simulation and Innovation (CESI), one of the most-advanced medical simulation training centers in the world. When hospitals cannot provide the advanced care, expertise and new treatment options their patients require, they turn to us. The Hartford Hospital is part of the Hartford HealthCare System, which includes St. Vincent's Medical Center in Bridgeport, CT and the Spine Wellness Center in Westport, CT.

Description:
This role will be responsible for collection, implementation, maintenance and analysis of large data sets originating from electronic medical record, Caboodle, Premier, and REDCap. Participates in the design, development and on-going Clinical Research and Quality data collection for the Ayer Neuroscience Institute Clinicians and Clinical Research Investigators. This position reports to the Ayer Neuroscience Clinical Research Director. This position will be located at the Spine Wellness Center in Westport, CT.

Three to five years relevant information systems experience.
Bachelor's degree or equivalent years of information systems knowledge related to the field. Strong interpersonal skills and customer orientation required.
May require specific technical/clinical/business degree.
Strong PC and analytical skills essential.
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Time management and organizational skills.
Excellent communication skills

Database knowledge (modeling, ETL)
SQL coding skills
EPIC (Clarity Inpatient certification) - Preferred

Qlikview - Preferred
Crystal Reports - Preferred

Ability to efficiently work in a team environment, handling multiple projects and deliverables
Ability to perform data mining, statistical and quantitative analysis

Position Summary
Responsible for the analysis, requirement gathering, documenting requirement stories based on business needs in support of critical integrated system releases. The Business Analyst is essential for ensuring business value is delivered per expected outcomes and production applications remain stable with excellent performance and optimal scalability. The ideal candidate for this business analyst role will be responsible for bridging the gap between IT and the business using data analytics to assess processes, determine requirements, and deliver data-driven recommendations and reports to executives and stakeholders The Mgr., Business Analyst will work in an Agile scrum team environment, in close collaboration with business partners, Plan Sponsor domain team, product owners, scrum teams, architecture and other IT partners.

Required Qualifications
Consistently performs analysis and translates business needs to create high-quality Business Requirements, with documented stories and Functional Specifications documentation within specified time frames to solve most complex problems (multiple interfaces with other systems across multiple business units) considering all impacted components from an end to end perspective. Ensures end-to-end traceability of requirements to completion. Creates appropriate communication materials are documents and distributes appropriately. Expert in one or more business systems. Applies specific functional and/or business expertise to perform assigned tasks and develop specific project deliverables. Conducts impact analysis of technology changes on business processes and existing technology. Competent to work at the highest technical capacity on most phases of the business systems analysis. Contributes to the review of Test Planning and Test Execution strategies with proven ability to manage projects and user testing. Develops business workflow diagrams. Assists business and/or architecture in the development of data models and interface design specifications. Documents, tracks, and resolves issues related to data quality. Contributes to the design and mapping of data conversion strategies. Participates in collaborative requirement, system and data design sessions with the user community, technical architecture resources, and development resources. Completes project activities on time and within budget, and proactively identifies and communicates issues that may jeopardize milestones or project budget to the Project Manager and Release Train Engineer. Adheres to EDF - Enterprise Delivery Framework methodology which consists of AGILE end to end domain model methodology by utilizing internal procedures and tools and identifying areas for methodology improvement. Includes, documenting and storing all appropriate documentation in the respective repositories.

Preferred Qualifications
Business Analysis experience with Healthcare experience in one or more of these areas: - Benefits and Plan Sponsor, Claim Adjudication, Network and Provider, Billing Member Enrollment. Develops Product Overviews, FAQs, Tool Glossaries, system training material, and system user documentation to support implementation activities. Expert in multiple Plan business systems. Guides and advises less-experienced Business Analysts. Mgr., Business Analysis assigned as Lead on a project ensures other BA's assigned to the project are completing their deliverables of high quality and on-time. High proficiency in technical writing. Conducts interviews, fact-finding, and independent research to design creative, progressive IT solutions for business problems, Conducts retrospectives and demos for key stakeholders with the scrum teams.

Soft Skills

Ability to facilitate meetings, while actively engaging key participants. Excellent documentation skills to produce process documentation, reports, with quality meeting notes including not limited to next steps and takeaways. Excellent analytical and problem solving skills. Excellent communication skills with ability to translate data into business terms. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Strong working knowledge of relevant Microsoft applications, including Visio. Ability to manage changing priorities. Ability to multitask effectively, prioritizing business impact and urgency. Ability to work in a team environment to deliver quality artifacts, products and projects Self-starter, who takes initiative with challenging situations.


Education
Bachelor’s degree in a Business or IT field, or an equivalent combination of education and work experience. Expectation of prior business analyst experience of 2- 5 years.

Efficiency

Microsoft applications (Excel, Word, Power Point, including Visio). RTC (Rational Teams Concert) an IBM Rationale program. Rally Software programs. An understanding of Clarity.

$63,300.00 - $136,500.00

Who we are...

COCC delivers complete enterprise processing solutions to financial institutions throughout the northeastern United States. Listed among American Banker's FinTech 100 and the Inc. 5,000 fastest growing companies in the nation, COCC inspires the industry with innovation and top quality support. Designated as a Top Workplace in Connecticut and a National Great Place to Work, COCC recognizes employees as the core of our success! COCC offers a progressive training program to support employees in personal and professional development.

What we need…

The Product Development group is the focal point for all activities pertaining to product strategy, market requirements, positioning, and launch of products. We are looking for a motivated, team-player who possesses a comprehensive understanding of the banking industry combined with project management experience, business analysis/critical thinking techniques, presentation skills and the capability to take a new product or service from design to implementation at a client.

The Product Analyst II plays a role throughout the implementation and/or development lifecycle. From a functional perspective, she/he needs to be comfortable working on issues across a range of disciplines including operations, technology, compliance/legal, marketing, and pricing. Once a product is ready for launch, the Product Analyst II should be prepared to perform initial demonstrations to clients and coworkers, consult with the clients on the implementation and best practices and assist with the transition of support roles to the customer support team.

What’s in it for you…

COCC offers a unique and collaborative experience as you grow your career with us and all of the benefits you’d expect from an award-winning employer plus:

A hybrid schedule allowing you the flexibility to balance your work/life needs
A customized training plan to successfully onboard you through your first year
A robust employee training and development program aligned with career pathing objectives
Generous PTO offering as well as competitive pay and benefits
On-site fitness center / off-site fitness/wellness reimbursement
Tuition Reimbursement
One-on-one career coaching
Financial planning assistance with certified professionals
Fun employee events such as company outings, trivia, sports leagues wellness events
Peer recognition programs

What you’ll do…

Product Development:

Work with the development teams, coworkers and clients to identify product needs, new products to be available and strategies to deploy them.
Determine product needs (business impact, client requirements, etc.) and gain approval. Analyze business needs against current system functionality and industry standards for such processing, create requirements document for development, attend walk through sessions and participate in the critical thinking process. Host focus groups and participate in product forums hosted by COCC to gather information and identify clients to work with on development requirements.
Perform User Acceptance Testing to ensure the product aligns with the original client requirements. Build test environment within database by creating/maintaining/editing accounts and/or system / bank / product options. Process transaction sets according to defined script and document findings.
Develop release documentation providing details on new functionality and system changes.
Assist with the training department to determine training needs and documentation and assist them in coordinating these events.
Interface with customer support for more detailed support as necessary

Product Implementations:

Work with the initial adopters of new product functionality with the product launch.
Perform new product/service setup, determine parameters and client needs with respect to the launch and maintain expectations that are in line with the functionality.
Assist and in some cases perform the initial end user training and determine best practices.
Follow up post implementation and provide initial support. Work to transition training and support to the appropriate departments within customer service.

Perform Product Usage Review and Visits

Identify key COCC products and services that may be underutilized. Work with the product manager to develop a strategy to ensure these products are not overlooked.
Author power user documents for areas of weakness or underutilization.
Perform product visits at the client site to review existing products and services used. Look to identify areas where a client may optimize their processing or add to their product suite. Ensure products and services that offer benefits are not overlooked by introducing them via client visit. Assist in performing presentations at one of COCC’s conferences or at a client site.

Assist Partner Departments within COCC

Actively work with the training, support, conversion and marketing teams as needed.
Assist the support team when they are unclear or have a need for better understanding of utilization of a product or service or need assistance to troubleshoot a high level issue.
Host training classes or webinars in an effort to assist the training department on power user products or services where knowledge or resources may be limited.
As new clients move to COCC and look to be early implementers of a new product, assist the conversion team to ensure a full understanding of its usage as well as ensure a smooth transition to support.
Perform marketing demonstrations as directed by the product manager.
Assist the marketing team in periodically setting up the marketing database to ensure it has the newest products and services available and ready for demonstration.
Assists other areas within organization based upon skill set and task knowledge as needed.
Participate in miscellaneous assignments in a manner which promotes team work and professional corporate image.

What you’ll bring…

Bachelor’s degree is preferred for this role but will consider appropriate work experience and/or relevant certifications.
Experience in a customer facing role
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to quickly learn complex computer systems and read/understand technical documentation
Ability to communicate effectively with all levels of staff and management both verbally and in writing
Excellent customer service skills and the ability to maintain composure when dealing with dissatisfied customers
Demonstrated ability presenting to small work groups on both technical and functional requirements
Team oriented with good interpersonal skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with coworkers
Intermediate Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, and Outlook)
Can comfortably handle risk and uncertainty
Ability to multi-task while completing projects under tight timelines

General Re Corporation, a subsidiary of Berkshire Hathaway Inc., is a holding company for global reinsurance and related operations,with more than 2,000 employees worldwide. Its direct reinsurance companies conduct business as Gen Re.

Gen Re delivers reinsurance solutions to the Life/Health and Property/Casualty insurance industries. Represented in all major reinsurance markets through a network of more than 40 offices, supported by over 2,000 employees worldwide, we have earned superior financial strength ratings from each of the major rating agencies.

Gen Re currently offers an excellent opportunity for a Technical Business Analyst in our Stamford, CT office or performed remotely for appropriately qualified individual.

Role Description

As an integral part of the Gen Re Global Life Business Technology team, the Technical Business Analyst will work with cross-functional stakeholders and external clients to understand their business needs and design, build, and operationalize the best-in-class solutions. This role is responsible for leading business requirements, analysis and testing phases of a project. Technical Business Analyst also contributes to the overall planning, technical design and implementation of a project including process changes. The Technical Business Analyst role is expected to work independently on multiple assignments with a sense of urgency, structure, and attention to detail.

Position Responsibilities include:

Provide analysis, technical design and planning activities for business and technology initiatives:

Determine and define project scope and objectives

Perform and document requirements gathering and analysis

Design high level technical solutions including frontends, databases and interfaces

Facilitate business process changes

Manage the product development team to create a strong end product

Develop and implement test plans to ensure successful delivery

Schedule and lead meetings to identify and correct issues

Provide project updates on a consistent basis to various stakeholders about strategy, adjustments, and progress

Prepare solution for deployment including support staffing, documentation, maintenance procedures and training
Small to medium size projects
Predict resources needed to reach objectives and manage resources in an effective and efficient manner
Prepare project budget and track costs
Develop and manage a detailed project schedule and work plan
Partner with cross-functional users to maintain and develop high quality solutions in a timely and cost-effective manner
Ability to work/meet during flexible hours. This person will need to coordinate with international users across different time zones (USA, Europe and Asia).
Collaborate with internal Technology resources to drive enterprise-wide strategies, procedures, and standards

Provide end-users support including business queries and requests

Provide technical assistance and cross training to business users and other team members

Role Qualifications and Experience

Bachelor’s Degree or higher in Information Science or related field is preferred.Equivalent combination of experience, education and training will be considered
7 or more years of experience as business analyst of software development related projects through the full life cycle required. Project manager or product owner experience with business analysis background can be considered.

Knowledge of Insurance or Re-insurance domain is required. Experience in Policy Administration is preferred.

Product Owner or Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) certification or equivalent is preferred

Knowledge of SQL and relational databases is preferred

Proven ability to complete projects according to outlined scope, budget, and timeline

Strong working knowledge of SDLC and Agile development principles and processes

Demonstrated ability to translate complex technical terminology, concepts and issues in terms understandable to technical and non-technical management and resource staff

Ability to work collaboratively throughout the organization by establishing effective working relationships

Creative and innovative thinker

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Excellent verbal and written communication skills and interpersonal skills

Salary Range

90,000.00 - 151,000.00 USD

The Business Intelligence Analyst supports end-to-end data management across the CapSpecialty ecosystem. In addition, the Business Analyst partners with various business and IT stakeholders to deliver new solutions as well as maintain the existing business intelligence solutions. This role will work to proactively identify issues and gaps in our data assets and/or data environment and work to find solutions to fix the root cause. This will also include working with business and IT stakeholders to help them articulate issues and turn reported issues into concise development requirements to close the issue/gap. This role will strive, with the rest of the data team, to make sure the business intelligence solutions are prioritized, built, tested, and deployed in a timely manner.

Duties & Responsibilities:

Serve as a technical data liaison between business users, systems, and analytical teams
Assist in the planning and development of a requirements attainment strategy for new business intelligence projects. Engage business and IT stakeholders to elicit requirements.
Develop BI use cases, requirements, POCs, as needed to meet business intelligence needs across the organization.
Design, develop, and maintain complex SQL queries and support ad-hoc requests for the creation of BI reports and dashboards.
Collaboration with IT and other business teams on Business Intelligence solutions to review and test solutions to ensure effective implementation.
Responsible for providing production support triage as needed, coordinating/validating changes within the data environment.
Support and maintain current Business Intelligence tools and solutions.
Build and expand business intelligence skill set. As new processes and/or tools are introduced into the data environment, work to learn new technologies and methodologies to enable support. Work to understand tools and processes across the entire data pipeline, enabling the identification of root causes across any step in the data pipeline.
Assist with the development of test strategies, writing and executing functional test cases, developing test execution plans, assessing defect severity, providing a status of testing activities and driving defects/issues to resolution.
Improve business acumen as it pertains to the insurance industry and/or develop functional domain expertise within BI related disciplines (e.g., database design, report/dashboard design, statistical modeling, etc.).
Leverage business knowledge and expertise to drive business process improvements.

Education & Experience:

Bachelor's degree in a technical field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics, etc.), or equivalent.
3+ years of experience in data and reporting-related roles in an insurance or financial industry setting
Demonstrates success working with data discovery, analytics, visualization, and business intelligence tools such as SSRS, PowerBI, BusinessObjects, etc.
Thorough knowledge of relational database theory, data warehousing concepts, terminology and architecture, and SQL (creating tables, views, stored procedures, indexes, etc.)
Experience analyzing and interpreting information from multiple sources, resolving conflicts, and reconciling user requests with system functionality and business needs
Basic level proficiency with query performance tuning

Supervisory Responsibilities:

None

Purpose & Summary:

The IT BI analyst - is responsible for managing and supporting the organization's IT infrastructure. Duties include troubleshooting network systems and applications, developing reporting dashboards using SQL and Power BI, installing and maintaining computer systems, designing and repairing databases, exploring emerging technologies, and ensuring maximum system uptime. The role involves collaborating with various teams, providing user support, and streamlining processes to improve operational efficiency. Additionally, the administrator is involved in training end-users, staying updated on software trends, and undergoing continuous training as needed. Overall, this is a crucial role in maintaining reliable and secure technology services for the company while contributing to its growth and success.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
Mission & Culture: All employees are required to uphold the mission and values and conduct themselves with the highest level of professionalism
Troubleshooting Network Systems and Components: Investigate and resolve network-related issues, such as connectivity problems, firewall configurations, and hardware failures. Collaborate with the Network Administrator to address escalated network incidents effectively.
Reporting and KPI Monitoring: Work closely with management to develop reporting dashboards that monitor Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) related to IT systems and infrastructure. Utilize SQL, Power BI, IBM Cognos and other database software to collect, analyze, and present data in meaningful formats.
Assisting in Systems Administration: Provide aid and support in installing, configuring, monitoring, and maintaining computer systems, networks, and applications. Collaborate with other IT team members to ensure smooth operations and timely resolution of issues.
Designing and Repairing Databases: Follow diagrams and written instructions to design, repair, or set up databases, SharePoint, Power Apps, and other software platforms. Ensure the efficient and reliable functioning of these systems.
Development of Emerging Technologies: Stay informed about emerging technologies and evaluate how they can benefit the company's operations. Propose and implement innovative solutions to improve efficiency and productivity.
Time Management: Efficiently manage time to work on tasks until completion within required deadlines. When necessary, coordinate with third-party vendors to resolve issues effectively.
Training and Documentation: Develop training materials to educate end users on data entry, management, and utilization of dashboards. Provide detailed documentation related to database development and issue resolution.
User Support: Assist with user-related issues, including configuration, password reset, user account setup, profiles, and email management.
Building Relationships: Establish positive working relationships with staff, customers, and other professionals to facilitate effective communication and collaboration.
Process Streamlining: Identify opportunities to streamline existing processes and develop programs that improve operational efficiency.
Flexibility in Duties: Be willing to take on additional responsibilities as assigned by the management or Director of IT.
Maximizing System Uptime: Be instrumental in maintaining the maximum uptime of all IT systems. Proactively suggest improvements to enhance system reliability and performance.
Collaboration and Teamwork: Act as a key team player within the IT team and work closely with senior management to align IT strategies with the company's overall goals.
Staying Updated on Software Trends: Continuously learn and stay up-to-date with the latest software trends and industry best practices.
Additional Training: Undertake additional training as required to meet the evolving business needs and the demands of the IT environment.
Education, Qualifications and Requirements:
Experience: A minimum of four (4) years of experience as in IT Bi Analyst, with a focus on infrastructure management and support. Previous experience in troubleshooting network systems and components is essential.
Technical Expertise: Proficiency in administering Windows and Linux server environments is preferred. Familiarity with network protocols (TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, VPN) and experience working with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) is important. Knowledge of database management systems (MySQL, Oracle, SQL Server) and reporting tools (SQL, Power BI, IBM Cognos etc.) is advantageous.

Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
IT Infrastructure: In-depth knowledge of IT infrastructure components, including servers, networks, storage systems, virtualization technologies, and cloud platforms.
Operating Systems: Proficiency in administering Windows and Linux operating systems, including installation, configuration, and troubleshooting.
Networking Concepts: Understanding of network protocols, topologies, and components, such as TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, VPN, routers, switches, and firewalls.
Database Management: Familiarity with database systems, such as MySQL, Oracle, SQL Server, IBM Cognos and the ability to perform basic database operations.
Security Best Practices: Knowledge of security measures, practices, and tools to protect IT assets, data, and systems from potential threats.
Troubleshooting Techniques: Strong problem-solving skills to diagnose and resolve technical issues efficiently, including root cause analysis.
Cloud Computing: Familiarity with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud, and the ability to deploy and manage cloud-based services.
Software and Application Support: Understanding of software applications, installation, and support procedures.
Database and Reporting Skills: Ability to develop databases using SQL, Power Bi, and other database software to create reporting dashboards for monitoring KPIs.
Systems Administration: Proficiency in installing, configuring, monitoring, and maintaining computer systems, networks, and applications.
Network Troubleshooting: Skills to troubleshoot network systems, components, and application problems, including configuring and replacing parts.
Documentation: Strong ability to create and maintain comprehensive documentation of system configurations, troubleshooting steps, and standard operating procedures.
Collaboration and Communication: Excellent interpersonal skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams, management, customers, and other professionals.
Training and Education: Ability to develop training materials and educate end users on data entry, management, and dashboard utilization.
Time Management: Ability to manage time efficiently and prioritize tasks to meet required deadlines.
Flexibility and Adaptability: Capability to take on additional responsibilities and adapt to evolving business requirements and technology trends.
Continuous Learning: Willingness to stay updated on software trends, industry best practices, and emerging technologies.
Customer-Service Oriented: A focus on providing excellent customer service to end users and maintaining a positive user experience.
Problem-Solving: Ability to analyze complex issues, think critically, and implement effective solutions.
Team Player: Being a cooperative and collaborative team member, working closely with other IT professionals and senior management.

Physical and Environmental Demands:
Sitting and Standing: The job often requires prolonged periods of sitting in front of computers, working at desks, and standing while attending to servers or network equipment.
Lifting and Carrying: IT Bi Analyst may need to lift and carry computer equipment, servers, or other hardware components, which can vary in weight. The ability to lift and move equipment safely is essential.
Dexterity and Mobility: The job may involve fine motor skills and manual dexterity to connect cables, configure hardware, and perform other technical tasks.
Vision and Hearing: Good vision is crucial for reading technical documentation, configuring systems, and troubleshooting issues. Adequate hearing is necessary to communicate effectively with colleagues and users.
Temperature: In server rooms, the temperature can be cooler due to the need to maintain optimal conditions for equipment. In contrast, office environments typically have controlled temperatures.
Noise: Server rooms can be noisy due to cooling systems, fans, and other equipment. Office environments are generally quieter but may still have some ambient noise.
Electrical Hazards: IT Bi Analyst works with electrical equipment and devices. Knowledge of electrical safety practices is essential to minimize the risk of accidents or injuries.
Limited Physical Activity: While there may be occasional tasks that require physical activity, much of the work involves using computers, managing systems, and troubleshooting, which do not involve extensive physical exertion.

Background Screening:
As part of CW's commitment to maintaining a safe and secure work environment a comprehensive background screening will be conducted. Employment verification will be performed to validate work experience, and education verification will be conducted to confirm educational qualifications. Professional license and credential verification will be conducted if applicable to the position. A criminal background check will be carried out to identify any past criminal convictions or ongoing legal issues. In addition, a credit check may be performed to assess financial responsibility. Reference checks will be conducted to gather insights into the candidate's work ethic and performance. Regulatory and compliance checks will also be conducted to ensure the candidate has not been involved in any violations or issues that could pose risks to the organization. Please note that a DDS (Department of Developmental Services) check will also be included as part of the background screening process for this position. All background checks will be conducted in compliance with applicable laws and regulations while maintaining strict confidentiality and adhering to privacy guidelines.

Furthermore, it is important to be aware that background checks may be periodically repeated during the course of employment to ensure ongoing suitability and compliance with our organization's standards. By accepting this position, you consent to the background screening process, which may include security verification, employment verification, education verification, criminal background checks, credit checks, reference checks, integrity assessments, regulatory and compliance checks, and DDS checks. Rest assured that all information obtained through the background check process will be handled with the utmost confidentiality and in compliance with applicable laws and regulations.

Company Overview

At Global Guardian, client safety and satisfaction are their top priorities. Global Guardian is a provider of world-class security solutions, custom-tailored to the individual needs of its global client base. They offer a comprehensive and integrated suite of best-in-class security, emergency, and medical services that help clients identify and mitigate the risks of traveling and doing business both overseas and domestically.

Solutions and services include personnel location sharing and monitoring, emergency response, security and transportation support, intelligence and due diligence, medical support, medical evacuation, emergency and custom aviation, cyber security, and video surveillance monitoring.

Global Guardian’s Operations Center outside Washington DC and security teams in over 130 countries, give clients peace of mind in knowing that no matter where they are in the world, Global Guardian stands ready to support quickly 24/7/365.

Position Overview

The Global Security Operations Center Analyst will be responsible for managing client data, international travel itineraries, global beacon tracking devices, security operations requests, worldwide intelligence gathering, analysis and presentation, and assisting clients under duress traveling. The Global Security Operations Center Analyst will report directly to the Operations Center Manager.

Duties and Responsibilities

Build Travel Assessments based on client’s itinerary and available intelligence
Manage GPS based global tracking devices and platform
Coordinate and direct international security team members in support of clients under duress
Identify and prioritize emergency situations as they develop internationally
Research, analyze and develop real-time intelligence reports based on client’s travel and site needs
Respond to and resolve security inquiries/issues quickly and decisively
Communicate effectively verbally and in writing with a diverse group of people which include C-suite executives, support staff, international security operators, international law enforcement and international operation centers
Perform Operations Center functions such as:
Responding to phone calls and emails
Entering and updating client data
Maintaining duty logs
Updating and organizing department shared drive files and applications
Conducting organized, timely, and effective handovers
Conduct regular client interface related functions while delivering exceptional customer service
Perform all other related duties as assigned including but not limited to assisting with briefing and presentation efforts and the creation of intelligence products on demand

Qualifications

Military/first responder experience is preferred
1-2 years in a customer support/security environment required
Ability to manage multiple projects at a time while paying strict attention to detail
Excellent verbal and written communication skills to interact with large corporate clients and high net worth families and individuals.
Must possess strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently with minimal guidance
Detail oriented
Strong analytical skill set and strong presentation skills with the ability to leverage data and provide recommendations for travelers
Experience in delivering client-focused solutions based on customer needs

Work Environment & Schedule

Work schedule is shift work covering 1300-2100 EST M-F, excluding company recognized holidays

Position Summary

Proactively defines, identifies, develops and creates data responsive to regulatory requirements and provides oversight, coaching and mentoring of team member work. This includes, but is not limited to the following:

Perform analytical work requiring ability to capture, analyze and interpret claims data
Manage translation of business needs into business requirements
Ensure project documentation is accurate and complete
Create queries; perform technical programming
Present data in a clear organized format
Creatively translate information using business knowledge and identify additional information needed to support analytical objectives
Review team member work for accuracy and completeness
Mentor and train team members
Run 1 - 2 projects simultaneously and independently while providing team guidance with minimal oversight

The successful candidate will be a detail-oriented individual with strong data analysis and analytical skills who is capable of providing leadership and guidance, while also working independently. Responsibilities include review of state regulations, review of compliance interpretation, writing business specifications, data quality review, data preparation, compliance to regulatory requirements, reviewing team member work, providing mentoring/training, running multiple projects simultaneously and independently while providing team guidance with little, or no oversight. Proficiency in all Microsoft Office applications (Excel, Word, Teams) is required.

Candidates should know SQL; or SAS; and/or technical capabilities relative to data mining & report generation. Knowledge of claims processing, claims quality audit programs, patient management, and/or a working understanding of Aetna products is highly preferred. The candidate will have excellent project management, communication and coaching/training skills and will meet deadlines, balance multiple priorities and demonstrate flexibility. The candidate should exhibit the ability to quickly and positively adapt to a changing environment. It is essential that the candidate builds and maintains effective working relationships with peers, management and others within and across organizational lines. Also desired is demonstrated critical thinking and the ability to articulate ideas clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing. We value a desire and willingness to learn. Some overtime will be required.

Required Qualifications

3+ years of data interpretation, data management, and analysis experience.
At least 2+ years of experience working with advanced SQL queries or SAS.
3+ years of Demonstrated leadership.
3+ years of project management experience.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Demonstrated ability to effectively coordinate multiple projects simultaneously.
Experience working within the Healthcare analytics space.


Preferred Qualifications

Preference for candidate's to have experience with member or provider experience in Healthcare.


Education Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience

Company Description

Louis Dreyfus Company is a leading merchant and processor of agricultural goods. Our activities span the entire value chain from farm to fork, across a broad range of business lines, we leverage our global reach and extensive asset network to serve our customers and consumers around the world. Structured as a matrix organization of six geographical regions and ten platforms, Louis Dreyfus Company is active in over 100 countries and employs approximately 17,000 people globally.

Job Description

This position is responsible for working alongside the regional Atlas – BPM to assist in implementation of the ATLAS (trade capture system) within the North America region as it relates to finance department. Additionally, they will collaborate with trading, operations and technology partners to identify, develop, and implement best and leading core business processes in order to drive business transformation within the North America region. This role involves the development of clear and concise process maps and the identification of associated business requirements.

Primary Responsibilities/Essential Functions

Oversee functional implementation of systems

Gather project status details and deliver periodic functional status update to project stakeholders during Steerco.
Assist regional IT project team during gap analysis workshops.
Maintain “Core Model” and assist in documenting the gaps between local requirements and the core model.
Manage master data transformation process.
Support project team on system testing and cut-over activities.
Lead change management activities for finance department.
Conduct training of key users on the functional usage of systems and best practices.
Provide level 1 support to business in case of issues during project.
Ensure proper hand over of support to regional IT team for post go-live support.
Understand, report and work alongside the BA/support to correct issues with the system’s behavior.
Provide post go-live monitoring of the quality of implementation.

On-Going Process Improvement Support

Job Summary:

Pratt & Whitney Engineering is looking for a self-motivated and disciplined individual to join its team as a Business Manager on a major Military or Commercial engine program. The Business Manager is responsible for the integration, analysis and reporting of cost and schedule data to the engineering Component Integrated Product Team (CIPT) leads responsible for the task and budget management on their Engine Modules.

The Business Manager plays an important role in preparing data needed to support high-quality Cost, Schedule, Manpower, and Earned Value (EV) management and reporting required by these programs. He/she will work with the individual engineering Control Account Managers (CAMs) and the corresponding Program Offices to identify budget estimates, support proposals, track monthly costs and staffing levels, support the manpower process, measure and track outsourcing, and communicate risks and opportunities. Success will be measured by meeting program timelines and proactively managing cost and schedule risks for the assigned program(s).

Qualified candidates need to be able to communicate effectively and coordinate between a diverse team of individuals. The Business Manager needs to be detailed and customer focused to ensure that the team meets the demands of this program. This role is a challenging and rewarding career development or broadening opportunity for the right individual looking for a career in Engineering Leadership, Engineering Finance, Program Finance or Program Management.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor Science Degree

5+ years of experience in Engineering, Program management, Business or Finance; OR 3+ years with an Advanced Degree

U.S. Person or eligible to obtain necessary export authorizations required

Preferred Qualifications:

Security Clearance Preferred

Degree in Engineering or Business Administration, MBA a plus

Proficiency with Excel, PowerPoint, and SAP

Strong analytical, problem-solving and trending skills

Focus on results and the ability to drive tasks to completion

Demonstrated effectiveness in working across functions, organizations and all levels of management

Working knowledge of continuous improvement principles

Ability to craft clear communication and develop meaningful relationships

Knowledge of Program Management toolsets and concepts

Capgemini is looking for a Business Analyst in Milford CT with the following skill-sets.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Business Analyst: Digital transformation experience / Web & Mobile / Marketing Windows preferred

Liaising with stakeholders to gather, document, and analyze detailed business/system/product requirements needed by Technology teams to deliver projects.
Identify gaps in requirements and follow up with stakeholders to resolve gaps, communicate requirements clearly using a variety of formats (e.g., user stories, acceptance criteria, functional requirements)
Develop technical, functional, and strategic artifacts such as solution diagrams, business requirements, and business cases to support delivery of the projects across the SDLC.
Become a subject matter expert in the Subway ecosystem and develop the ability to explain technical concepts in simple terms to business stakeholders.
Plan, prioritize and manage project scope and product feature backlog and development of requirements and user stories where appropriate.
Work closely with internal and external customers and stakeholders, including any third parties to gather business requirements and define software functionality, throughout the release lifecycle, from inception to general release to ongoing support. May also work with internal and/or external development teams and vendor partners to deliver project objectives.
Support the project and program managers to ensure that the projects are delivered on budget and on time
Validate all requirements, stories meet acceptance criteria, has the appropriate acceptance tests and accept requirements and stories as appropriate only if it passes all validations
Create, Update, and Close Product Backlog/Features/Epics/et al, ensuring all tickets have been entered, information is correct, the status/owner are correct, and the ticket is not blocked.
Work with the Project Manager to proactively identify and remove roadblocks in application updates and issues identified during testing.
Adapt to changing expectations and project demands. Develop a client first mindset. Become well versed in the internal consulting methodology and frameworks. Be flexible to be utilized >90%.
Required Skills:
Good experience in detailed Agile and Waterfall projects, understands complex project interdependencies, is able to prioritize & manage multiple requests, stakeholders, and ongoing deadlines.

Experience analyzing nontechnical requirements, performing Root Cause Analysis, and working with stakeholders to resolve issues.
Experience working in fast moving and complex projects, with multiple dependencies and varying stakeholders.
Able to see the high level view of the project, while diving into the details to identify and fix bugs/issues.
Restaurant domain knowledge, POS - Point-of-Sales, Digital Web & Mobile, Marketing Windows, Marketing Tech - Adobe Analytics preferred.

Our Heart At Work Behaviors™ support this purpose. We want everyone who works at CVS Health to feel empowered by the role they play in transforming our culture and accelerating our ability to innovate and deliver solutions to make health care more personal, convenient and affordable.

Position Summary

As a Senior Manager Business Analyst in Information Technology at CVS Health/Aetna, you will work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment delivering innovative solutions. We are looking for passionate, driven person who wants to join our high energy and growing team to make a difference in customers’ lives.
Your responsibilities would include but are not limited to:
Working with internal business units to analyze objectives and develop solutions to business need.
Translating business needs into system requirements by creating specifications and screen “mock-ups” using, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word, Flowcharting software, etc.
Employ several techniques when eliciting requirements from business representatives including interviewing and facilitating workshops.
Provides input into developing and modifying systems to meet client needs and develops business specifications to support these modifications.
Plans, designs and recommends business processes to improve and support business activities.
Solving system related problems, such as malfunctions and program problems as reported by users.
Working closely with Software Developers to ensure technical compatibility and user satisfaction.
Creating project plans and driving projects to completion.
Participates in technical reviews and inspections to verify 'intent of change' is carried out through the entire project.
Independently managing multiple projects and priorities.
Testing new features and functionality by creating test scenarios and measurements, verifying results and performing regression testing..
Assisting technical documenters and Trainers as needed with software updates.
Utilize Microsoft Transact-SQL for testing, trouble-shooting and providing data to business units on an ad hoc basis.


Required Qualifications

7+ years of relevant experience
3+ years of experience creating / managing Insurance enrollment systems - Broker and Member facing
3+ years of experience creating requirements for Broker websites.


Preferred Qualifications

Self-motivated to take ownership and accountability as the servant leader of the team.
Highly organized to manage multiple tasks simultaneously adjusting priorities to meet deadlines while producing high quality output.
Understanding of resource allocations and forecasting.
Healthcare or Insurance industry experience.
Proficiency in Agile collaboration tools including RTC, Rally, Teams, Miro, etc.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Strong analytic and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work independently and in a team environment.


Education
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent work experience.

$79,200.00 - $170,800.00

Position Summary

The Senior Analyst, Sales Support is an individual contributor role responsible for managing detailed customer IT assessments, working in partnership with the Aetna field account management teams and internal experts. This position manages complex, time-sensitive requests from current customers across the Aetna commercial business and specialty segments. The ability to identify, assess, and resolve business challenges is required. This individual needs to have knowledge of enterprise and Aetna technical assets, systems, and business practices to support account teams with meeting the diverse and often extensive requirements included in customer IT assessments. Additional key components of this position include:

Collaboration and partnership within commercial business segments and with other business areas to ensure all workflow processes and interdependencies are identified and addressed.
Driving changes needed to improve process, timeliness, and the quality of our responses.
Maintenance of standard responses to support accuracy, consistency and response time.
Development of strong, positive relationships with the field account teams and internal partners.


Required Qualifications

4+ years of relevant experience that includes 2 years of client questionnaire and/or RFP/RFI experience.
Experience with content management applications.
Proven ability to deliver high quality work that meets or exceeds customer expectations and consistently meets both internal and external deadlines.
High level of proficiency with employee productivity tools including, but not limited to Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, SharePoint) and Web meeting applications
Exceptional time management with the ability to prioritize multiple assignments and meet deadlines.
History of focusing on customer needs and providing outstanding service.
Excellent communication skills (written / verbal) at all levels of the organization.
Excellent attention to detail and critical thinking skills required.
Able to work independently, but also able to work with people in a team environment.
Demonstrated ability to adjust to different or new approaches to assignments and openness to feedback.
Ability to act as an advisor to management and colleagues on technical, informational, and operational issues.


Preferred Qualifications

Familiarity with project management processes and tools.
Familiarity with process improvement, and root cause analysis concepts.


Education

Bachelor’s degree in a Business or IT field strongly preferred, and/or equivalent work experience (HS diploma + 4 years relevant experience).

About IFG Companies

IFG Companies, founded in 1985, is one of America’s largest privately held, property and casualty A-rated insurance groups in the United States. As a private company, IFG is focused on profitable growth through superior underwriting of a range of products and service to its producers and insureds.

LOCATION

IFG Companies is hiring in Arizona, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, New Jersey, North Carolina, and case-by-case in New York, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Texas and Virginia. Applicants must reside in one of these states to be hired. Remote and flexible work arrangements are provided to all employees based on manager approval.

SALARY RANGE

The expected salary range is $115,000 to $130,000 and subject to change at any time at the discretion of the Company.

POSITION SUMMARY

The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst will assist business stakeholders and operations gain data driven insights. Partner with underwriting, operations, Actuarial and marketing to develop and provide insights and analysis on trends and facilitate our business, including development and maintenance of underlying data tables. Designs and program new processes and dashboards following corporate data governance model.

POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES

Work with business partners through the analysis of quantitative and qualitative data using data querying.
Develop Quality Control measures for the reports and dashboards.
Designs and develops new reports, dashboards, data tables, etc. to provide speed-to-data insight
Enhance the efficiency, automation, and accuracy of existing reports by using standard data definitions as per business community.
Work with Business community to define standard definitions of data elements. Build and maintain data dictionary.
Follow best practices in data querying and manipulation to ensure data integrity.
Effectively communicate information to technical and non-technical audiences.
Provide support to business partners on creative analytical projects including design of custom reports
Subject matter expert in all aspects relating to data collection and analysis for internal customers

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Strong SQL Development experience including SQL Queries, Stored procedures, SSIS, etc.
Experience in SSMS, SSRS, SSAS, SSIS
Experience with visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, QlikView). Power BI is preferred.
Strong proficiency in MS Excel
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Experience in ACORD model is a HUGE plus

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE/CERTIFICATIONS

Bachelor's Degree in related field preferred
5+ years of experience in data warehousing and business intelligence required
Experience and knowledge of P&C insurance industry and strong knowledge of insurance products preferred.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

Physical demands are considered to be that of an office environment, climate controlled, with minimal physical exertion. This position requires prolonged sitting, ability to utilize a computer and interactions with others meetings or via phone.

BENEFITS

IFG Companies offers a competitive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), flexible spending, short-term and long-term disability insurance, life insurance, long-term care insurance, educational and professional development assistance, paid time off, company provided leave of absence programs and flexible work arrangements.

IFG Companies is an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse workforce. M/F/D/V

General Re Corporation, a subsidiary of Berkshire Hathaway Inc., is a holding company for global reinsurance and related operations, with more than 2,000 employees worldwide. Its direct reinsurance companies conduct business as Gen Re.

Gen Re delivers reinsurance solutions to the Life/Health and Property/Casualty insurance industries. Represented in all major reinsurance markets through a network of more than 40 offices, supported by over 2,000 employees worldwide, we have earned superior financial strength ratings from each of the major rating agencies.

Gen Re currently offers an excellent opportunity for a Financial Operations Analyst to work in the Life Health North America unit based in our in our Stamford, CT, or Portland, ME offices. Working remote or hybrid will be considered for the appropriately qualified individual. role.

Role Description

The responsibilities of a Financial Operations Analyst include:

Manage general ledger functions including month-end and quarter close, variance analysis and reconciliation of balances.
Participate in the preparation of information required for Annual Statements.
Process monthly and quarterly payments as needed, on a timely basis.
Post and import data, feeds and reports to the internal financial systems.
Coordinate the quarter close process between areas with regards to timelines and responsibilities.
Demonstrate technical and analytical skills to assess issues, understand the impacts and find solutions.
Identify areas of opportunity for process improvement.
Maintain effective communication and collaboration across internal Gen Re teams.
Contribute to the enhancement of internal process documentation.




Role Qualifications and Experience

3+ years of experience in a related role, preferably in the Life and Health insurance/reinsurance industry.

High degree of analytical and problem-solving skills.

Exceptional time management and prioritization skills.

Advanced MS Excel skill (v lookups, pivot tables, formula building) required.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Demonstrated ability to work independently and multi-task.

Salary Range

63,000.00 - 84,000.00 USD

The annual base salary range posted represents a broad range of salaries around the U.S. and is subject to many factors including but not limited to credentials, education, experience, geographic location, job responsibilities, performance, skills and/or training.

Our Address

General Reinsurance Corporation
120 Long Ridge Road
Stamford, CT 06902 (US)

At General Re Corporation, we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. It is the General Re Corporation continuing policy to afford equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, sex (including childbirth or related medical conditions), religion, national origin or ancestry, age, past or present disability, marital status, liability for service in the armed forces, veterans’ status, citizenship, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. In addition, Gen Re provides reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act.

Where would you step in?
As the Systems Analyst for our Digital Transformation Project, you will collaborate closely with our team to design and implement cutting-edge systems and processes that elevate our client service experience. You can sit in our Westfield or Worcester, MA office or our Middletown, CT office. We offer a hybrid work environment and flexible Fridays in the summer.

Our IT team
Our group plays a critical role in enabling an organization to operate efficiently, securely, and competitively in the digital age. The team supports every person, location, project, and initiative at the firm including strategy, hardware, software, network administration, cyber security, data management, and other initiatives. The IT function is critical to the success of the firm.

What will you be doing?
You will collaborate with business users and stakeholders to define business requirements, process workflows, and system needs for enterprise systems implementations. You will: evaluate existing business processes in the firm and identify areas for enhancement; translate business requirements into technical specifications; engage with technical consultants and system administrators to configure the ERP system to meet the needs of our civil consulting engineering firm; lead enterprise systems integration efforts; enable data-driven business decisions; develop training materials and conduct training for end-users; support change management activities; and keep abreast of industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies related to the REP systems in the AEC industry.

What do you need?
You will need a BS in business administration, information systems, engineering, or a related field and 5+ years of experience working as a business analyst or in a similar role, preferably in the AEC industry or with ERP implementations. You should have a strong understanding of business processes in the civil engineering domain, such as project management, resource planning, financial management, procurement, and contract management with familiarity with ERP systems commonly used in the AEC industry, such as BST Global, Deltek Vision, Unanet, Procore, or similar platforms. You should have proficient in requirements gathering, process analysis, and functional specification development. You should also be an excellent communicator and be able to manage multiple priorities.

Ways to grow your career
We offer tuition reimbursement, internal training opportunities, professional membership reimbursement, conference attendance and networking opportunities. We also offer a clear career path progression and mentorship from more experienced staff.

What is the culture like?
We are fully committed to the well-being of our employees, communities, and environment. Our inclusive culture is supportive and flexible so everyone can thrive. We genuinely like each other and enjoy events like our annual company-wide summer Lobsterfest, holiday parties, ball games, and other office activities. Giving back is also very important at Tighe & Bond; we demonstrate our commitment by providing multiple scholarships and encouraging employees to earn more PTO by participating in our award-winning Make a Difference community service program.

Your financial future and wellness
Our benefits consistently receive top marks from our employees, and they are designed for all generations, including a unique student loan repayment assistance program. We offer a $500 wellness program incentive, a generous PPO medical plan with a $0 in-network deductible, dental, eye care, life and disability insurance, flexible spending accounts, PTO, optional legal insurance, discounted pet insurance, adoption assistance, spot awards, scholarships for employees’ college students, paid parental leave, Leadership in Safety awards, employee referral incentives, and fitness, weight loss, and mind and body reimbursements. Project Manager salaries are determined based on internal equity and market analysis and will vary based on the candidate’s skill and experience; the salary range for this position is $89,000 - $116,000. As an employee-owned company, we also offer generous year-end bonuses and robust deferred income benefits to help you build wealth through our matching 401(k), ESOP, and annual profit sharing.

More about Tighe & Bond
We are a thriving, employee-owned engineering, design, and environmental consulting firm. In addition to being a top ten ENR New England Design Firm, we’ve been recognized as the 2023 Employer of the Year from SMPS Boston, ranked first in the Engineering and Environmental Services categories in Banker & Tradesman's "Best of" competition in 2022, and have been honored twice with the PSMJ Circle of Excellence award. With a team of 500+ designers, planners, scientists, and engineers, we offer creative solutions for land use, infrastructure, and building design, including addressing crucial challenges related to water resources, transportation, and both the built and natural environment throughout the Northeast. We are committed to growth, exceptional service, and designing for a more sustainable future.

Equal Opportunity Employer
